title: G4MF Mesh Deformation Blend Shape
description: A blend shape, also known as a morph target, defines how a mesh can be deformed by displacing its vertex positions and other attributes.

normal.description: The offset or displacement of the normal direction values for the blend shape. For meshes with multiple surfaces, the target indices refer to a combination of all normal value accessors for all surfaces in the mesh. For example, if surface 0 has 5 normal values, then surface 1's normal values are referenced startin from the number 5 in the target indices. Normals MUST be re-normalized before rendering after applying all blend shapes for a mesh.

position.description: The offset or displacement of the vertex positions for the blend shape relative to the base mesh's `vertices` property.

textureMap.description: The offset or displacement of the texture map's texture space coordinate values for the blend shape. For meshes with multiple surfaces, the target indices refer to a combination of all texture map value accessors for all surfaces in the mesh. For example, if surface 0 has 5 texture map values, then surface 1's texture map values are referenced starting from the number 5 in the target indices.
